message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.SI. 

The paper focuses on semantic measures for comparing units of language and concepts, which are central to Natural Language Processing (NLP) and knowledge-based treatments. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also mentions Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) as a field that federates with NLP to develop machines that can assist human operators. Information Retrieval (cs.IR) is also mentioned as a field that uses semantic measures to compare resources indexed by language units. Machine Learning (cs.LG) is another likely sub-category as it is a key component of many NLP and AI applications. Finally, Semantic Web (cs.SI) is a possible sub-category as the paper discusses the use of ontologies and semantic networks for estimating semantic similarity.
